case_vignette:
A 66-year-old man comes to the physician for a 3-month history of fatigue. He has hypertension and hyperlipidemia. He had a transient ischemic attack 3 years ago. He drinks 3 beers a day, and sometimes a couple more on social occasions. He currently takes aspirin, simvastatin, hydrochlorothiazide, and metoprolol. His temperature is 37.1°C (98.8°F), pulse is 78, respirations are 19/min, and oxygen saturation on room air is 97%. He is in no distress but shows marked pallor and has multiple pinpoint, red, nonblanching spots on his extremities. On palpation, his spleen is significantly enlarged. Laboratory studies show a hemoglobin of 8.0 g/dL, a leukocyte count of 80,000/mm3, and a platelet count of 34,000/mm3. A blood smear shows immature cells with large, prominent nucleoli and pink, elongated, needle-shaped cytoplasmic inclusions. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis? 
A) Acute myeloid leukemia
B) Chronic myeloid leukemia
C)  Chronic lymphocytic leukemia
D)  Acute lymphoblastic leukemia
E)  Polycythemia vera
F)  Essential thrombocytopenia
G)  Myelodysplastic syndrome
H)  Hairy cell leukemia
I)  Multiple myeloma
J)  Thrombocytopenia
K)  Thrombocytosis
L)  Leukemoid reaction
M)  Idiopathic thrombocytopenic purpura
N)  Chronic myelomonocytic leukemia
O)  Chronic eosinophilic leukemia
P)  Chronic neutrophilic leukemia
Q)  Chronic megakaryocytic leukemia
R)  Chronic basophilic leukemia
S)  Chronic mastocytic leukemia
T)  Chronic erythroid leukemia
U)  Chronic monocytic leukemia
V)  Chronic lymphoblastic leukemia
W)  Chronic granulocytic leukemia
X)  Chronic lymphocytic leukemia variant
Y)  Chronic myeloid leukemia variant
Z)  Chronic lymphocytic leukemia variant with lymphadenopathy
The correct answer is
question: What is the final diagnosis?

Ask different questions to cover more information. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been feeling very tired for the last three months.
Have you noticed any changes in your weight or appetite recently?
No, I haven't noticed any changes in my weight or appetite.
Do you have any other symptoms like fever, night sweats, or unexplained bruises?
No, I don't have fever, night sweats, or unexplained bruises.
Have you experienced any shortness of breath or chest pain?
No, I haven't experienced any shortness of breath or chest pain.
Have you noticed any pale skin or feel like your heart is racing sometimes?
Yes, I have noticed that my skin is very pale.
Do you have any history of anemia or any other blood disorders in your family?
No, I don't have a history of anemia or any other blood disorders in my family.
Have you recently had any lab work or blood tests done? If yes, what were the results?
Yes, I recently had blood tests done. The results showed that my hemoglobin level is low at 8.0 g/dL, my white blood cell count is very high at 80,000/mm3, and my platelet count is low at 34,000/mm3.
Final Diagnosis: Chronic Myeloid Leukemia (CML)
